raw_response: {"answer_index": 1, "answer_text": "Cervical lymph nodes", "confidence": 10, "reasoning": "The clinical scenario describes a patient with a suspicious thyroid nodule, likely thyroid cancer. The most common type of thyroid cancer is papillary carcinoma, which typically metastasizes first to the cervical lymph nodes. Cervical lymph nodes are the most common initial metastatic site, while distant metastases (lungs, bones) occur later.", "evidence_quality": "normal"}
